question: Information in a database is typically stored in this object, which consists of vertical columns and horizontal rows of similar data.
All of the information about one entity (person, thing, place or event), is contained in this in a database.
The smallest unit of information about a record in a database is called an attribute and is stored in a
This type of database contains multiple tables that are connected to produce combined output from all tables
In Access this object finds and displays selected data.
When building a query, this is used to limit the results by some specific identifier, such as a date range.
Queries are based on this process, allowing you to use a query as the source for forms and reports.
This identifies a record in Access in the same way a license plate number uniquely identifies a car.
